Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2013 01:36AM Colcol wrote: Hi clsweet, I was diagnosed 6/21/12 at the age of 35 with IDC. I just celebrated one year of being NED!! I had to have cardiac testing done because I had open heart surgery when I was two to repair a hole in my heart, and they just wanted to verify everything was okay before I had my BMX. Also, before my BMX I did a round of IVF to have some frozen embryos available for me after I completed the tamoxifen treatment. The message boards have been a great help to me.
Posts.Title: IDC clsweet footprintsangel

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2013 09:25PM Colcol wrote: i am 5'2'' and 110lbs- my surgery was 8 hours. i had BXM w/lat flaps and TE
Posts.Title: Duration of PBMX surgery on a petite woman? BlueSky5 sarahjane7374

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2012 10:12AM Colcol wrote: Hi- I was diagnosed in June at the age of 35 with IDC and DCIS, both in the left breast. In June I had a lumpectomy and in July I had the sentinel lymph node biospy done, which thankfully came back clear. On 10/11/12 I had a bi-lateral mastectomy w/reconstrustion and the latissimus dorsi flap. I got my final pathology report from the mastectomy tissue and my breast surgeon said I made the absolute right decision because the report showed pre-cancerous cells in both breasts. My Mom was diagnosed at 55 with breast cancer and she is a survivor. I also tested negative for the BRAC1 and 2 gene. I will say each day since my surgery does get easier. I went home with 4 drains had two removed last week and hopefully the last two get removed tomorrow. Another good board to look at is youngsurvival.org.
Posts.Title: 31 years old, just diagnosed IDC beckstar18 msphil
